topic.title: Types Of Companies Which Would Benefit from the DITA XML Standard

body.p: I would divide in general the companies which benefit from using DITA XML for their user's manuals in three large sections:

section.title: Companies Creating Physical Products
section.p: These companies create real-world objects, be them weapons, cars, refrigerators or computer chips. Each version of each product has an unique product ID and needs to be documented. Different products are sometimes similar in functionality but they also have some differences.

section.title: Companies Creating Versioned Software Products
section.p: These companies provide software components which are versioned and usually get installed on the client's side. As each client may have an older version of the product, user manuals for older versions need to be made available.

section.title: Companies Creating Versionless Software Products
section.p: These companies usually provide cloud based services, the end user receives always access to the latest stable release, there is no user manual made available for past releases.
